level.heading: THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CHILD-PLACING AGENCY IN FOSTER CARE PLACEMENTS (§9-1643)

level.text: Each child-placing agency’s authority to place a child in foster care shall be documented in the organization’s policies and procedures.
After a child is placed in foster care, each child-placing agency shall provide casework services to the child, his birth family, and the foster parents, as appropriate.
Each child-placing agency shall ensure that the foster care services plan includes:
An estimation of the length of time the child is expected to be in foster care; and
A plan for permanency placement for the child which shall include any modifications needed in that plan.
